raw: Coronavirus puts brakes on sports car maker Ferrari .
replaced: Coronavirus puts brakes on sports car maker Ferrari .

raw: MILAN ( Reuters ) - Luxury sports car maker Ferrari ( RACE.MI ) cut its 2020 core profit forecast on Monday due to disruption caused by the coronavirus pandemic , which it said would mainly hit second quarter results .
replaced: Ferrari  cut  Ferrari  2020 core profit forecast on Monday due to disruption caused by the coronavirus pandemic , which Ferrari said would mainly hit second quarter results .

raw: The company , known for its red Formula One racing cars and its prancing horse logo , said it now expected adjusted earnings before interest , tax , depreciation and amortisation ( EBITDA ) to edge down from 2019 levels to 1.05 - 1.20 billion euros .
replaced: Ferrari  Ferrari red Formula One racing cars and Ferrari prancing horse logo , said Ferrari now expected adjusted earnings before interest , tax , depreciation and amortisation ( EBITDA ) to edge down from 2019 levels to 1.05 - 1.20 billion euros .

raw: In February , Ferrari had projected an increase in 2020 EBITDA to 1.38 - 1.43 billion euros .
replaced: In February , Ferrari had projected an increase in 2020 EBITDA to 1.38 - 1.43 billion euros .

raw: The Italian company , which on Monday restarted operations at its plants in Maranello and Modena , forecast a “ harsh ” reduction of revenues linked to Formula One , where races have been suspended , as well as reduced turnover from brand projects and lower engine shipments to Maserati .
replaced: Ferrari  Monday restarted operations at Ferrari plants in Maranello and Modena , forecast a “ harsh ” reduction of revenues linked to Formula One , where races have been suspended , as well as reduced turnover from brand projects and lower engine shipments to Maserati .

raw: At 1315 GMT , its shares were down 2.7 % at 139.55 euros , having fallen more than 5 % immediately after the news .
replaced: At 1315 GMT , Ferrari shares were down 2.7 % at 139.55 euros , having fallen more than 5 % immediately after the news .

raw: Morgan Stanley analysts said the guidance reduction was steeper than they had expected , but were encouraged Ferrari is still aiming to generate free cash flow this year .
replaced: Morgan Stanley analysts  Morgan Stanley analysts said cut was steeper than Morgan Stanley analysts had expected , but were encouraged Ferrari is still aiming to generate free cash flow this year .

raw: “ This extraordinary level of stability in an economic crisis takes top place at the podium and we expect investors to use any weakness as a buying opportunity , ” they said .
replaced: “ This extraordinary level of stability in an economic crisis takes top place at the podium and Morgan Stanley expect investors to use any weakness as a buying opportunity , ” Morgan Stanley analysts said .

raw: Ferrari , whose origins date back to 1929 , now expects industrial free cash flow of 100 - 200 million euros this year , compared with 400 million euros or more previously .
replaced: Ferrari now expects industrial free cash flow of 100 - 200 million euros this year , compared with 400 million euros or more previously .

raw: The company said its new guidance did not include a potential second wave of COVID-19 infections .
replaced: Ferrari said Ferrari new guidance did not include a potential second wave of COVID-19 infections .

raw: In the first quarter of this year , adjusted EBITDA rose 1.9 % to 317 million euros ( $ 347 million ) , broadly in line with a 322 million euro forecast in an analyst poll compiled by Reuters .
replaced: In the first quarter  this year , adjusted EBITDA rose 1.9 % to 317 million euros ( $ 347 million ) , broadly in line with a 322 million euro forecast in an analyst poll compiled by Reuters .

raw: Ferrari ’s two plants , both located in Italy ’s northern Emilia Romagna region , had been closed since mid March .

raw: Volumes rose despite delivery suspensions due to the virus outbreak , driven by 488 Pista and 488 Pista Spider models , along with the ramp up of the F8 Tributo , the company said .
replaced: Volumes rose despite delivery suspensions due to the virus outbreak , driven by 488 Pista and 488 Pista Spider models , along with the ramp up of the F8 Tributo , Ferrari said .

raw: The margin on adjusted EBITDA came in at 34 % in the first quarter , up from 33.1 % a year earlier .

raw: Ferrari said its total available liquidity at the end of March was 1.23 billion euros .

raw: Last month , it secured additional committed credit lines worth 350 million euros , with maturities up to 24 months , taking total committed , available and undrawn credit lines to 700 million euros , it said .
